ID	ENGLISH	POS GLOSS
1	a (an) (art.)	pakhat zong an
2	A-bomb (n.)	atomic bomb
3	A.D. (n., abbrev.)	Anno Domino; Kan Bawipa kum chungah, Bawi Jesuh chuah hnu
4	A.M. (n., abbrev.)	chun hlan
5	a priori (adj., adv.)	al len, ruah len hau ti lo i a ummi ruahnak, thil
6	abacus (n.)	Tuluk thilfonhnak
7	abandon (v.)	hlawt , kaltak
8	abase (v.)	niamter, i tthumh, i hmetter; e.g. He abased himself by drinking = Zudin in amah le amah aa niamter.
9	abate (v.)	a zor, a ttum; e.g. The storm will abate soon = Thlichia cu a zor (a ttum) zau lai.
10	abbess (n.)	Nu Khrihfa phungki pawl umnak i an haotu bik a simi.
11	abbey (n.)	Pathian rianttuantu hna a bu in nu phungki si hna seh, pa phungki si hna seh, an umnak inn
12	abbot (n.)	Pa phungki pawl an umnak i an haotu bik.
13	abbreviate (v.)	a tawinak in ttial
14	abdicate (v.)	kaltak, chuahtak, hlawt; e.g. The king abdicated his throne = Siangpahrang nih a bawi tthutdan a chuahtak.
15	abdomen (n.)	paw
16	abduct (v.)	soilem i a ping ah kalpi
17	abet (v.)	thil ttha lo tuah midang forh
18	abhor (v.)	huat, lungchung i fih
19	abide (v.)	1. i tlaihpeng, zulh, let lo; 2. um
20	ability (n.)	thil ti khawhnak
21	abject (adj.)	1. zohchia tiang i ttih; 2. zoh awk tlak lo tiang i sifah
22	abjure (v.)	chiatser in hlawt; e.g. The king ordered the Jews to abjure their religion = Siangpahrang nih Judah mi cu chiatser in an biaknak a hlawtter hna.
23	ablaze (adj.)	a alh pupmi
24	able (adj.)	kho, khawh; e.g. He is able to come = A ra kho.
25	ablution (n.)	thianh , phunglei in i thianh
26	abnegation (n.)	biaknak hlawt, mah duhnak hlawt.
27	abnormal (adj.)	hawi he aa lo lomi; e.g. He is an abnormal child = Amah cu hawi he aa lo lomi ngakchia a si.
28	aboard (adv.)	cung kai, cit; e.g. It is time to go aboard = Lawng cung kai caan a si cang.
29	abode (n.)	umnak hmun
30	abolish (v.)	hrawh, hloh; e.g. Slavery was abolished = Sal zuat cu hloh a si cang.
31	abominable (adj.)	fihnung; e.g. His behavior (behaviour) is abominable = A ziaza fih a nung.
32	abominate (v.)	fih , lungchung in fih
33	aboriginal (adj.)	ram a rak hlum hmasa bikmi hna
34	aborigines (n.)	ram a rak hlum hmasa bikmi hna
35	abort (v.)	1. nau hrawh; nau rawh. 2. donghter. Peace talks have to be aborted = Remnak biaruahnak an hrawh a hau.
36	abortion (n.)	nau rawk, thla tlin hlan nau chuah.
37	abortive (adj.)	a tlam a tling kho lomi; e.g. The construction project was abortive = Innsaknak project cu a tlam a tling lo.
38	abound (v.)	tampi an um; e.g. The river abounds in fish = Tiva ah nga tampi an um.
39	about (prep.)	1. hrawng; e.g. I shall come back at about 4 p.m. = Zanlei 4 hrawngah ka ra tthan lai; 2. kong; e.g. I know nothing about him = Amah kong zeihmanh ka hngal lo.
40	above (prep.)	cunglei; e.g. We flew above the cloud = Khuadawm cungin kan zuang.
41	abrade (v.)	tat, hnor, cuarkawh
42	abrasion (n.)	1. cuar kawhnak hmun; 2. cuar khawhnak
43	abreast (adj., adv.)	artlang; e.g. The soldiers marched four abreast = Ralkap cu artlang in pali in an kal.
44	abridge (v.)	tawiter
45	abridgment (n.)	tawiternak.
46	abroad (adv.)	mah ramleng kal; e.g. He is going abroad = Ramdang ah a tlawng.
47	abrogate (v.)	hrawh, let, zorter; e.g. His power was abrogated = A nawl ngeihnak kha a zor, a lo.
48	abrupt (adj.)	khulrang, duak; e.g. He made an abrupt turn to avoid an accident = Poipang ton sual lo dingah duak tiah aa mer.
49	abruptly (adv.)	khulrang ngaiin , duak tiin
50	abscess (n.)	hmahnai
51	abscond (v.)	zam; e.g. A thief absconded with the money = Mifir cu tangka he a zam.
52	absence (n.)	um lo; e.g. His absence from school was caused by illness = Sianginn a kai lo cu zawt ruangah a si. absence of mind = mah tuahmi kha zei a si ti hngalh khawh lo.
53	absent (v.)	um lo; e.g. He is absent from school = Sianginn a kai lo. absent
54	minded (adj.)	milunglo , thil a philh zaumi
55	absentee (n.)	a um lomi
56	absolute (adj.)	tling, hirhiar; e.g. You must tell the absolute truth = Biatak tling kha na chim lai.
57	absolutely (adv.)	tling tein
58	absolution (n.)	ngaihthiamnak , sual thianhnak
59	absolve (v.)	luatter, sualnak in luatter, sualnak in thianter
60	absorb (v.)	dawp; e.g. Cotton can absorb water = Lachawn nih ti a dawp khawh.
61	absorbable (adj.)	dawp khawhmi thil, hngalh khawhmi thil, cinken khawhmi thil, dolh khawhmi thil
62	absorbent (n.)	dawp khotu thil
63	absorbing (adj.)	lung la ngai a simi thil; e.g. This is an absorbing story = Hi tuanbia cu mi lungla ngaimi tuanbia a si.
64	abstain (v.)	sum; e.g. Abstain from strong drink = Zudin i sum.
65	abstainer (n.)	aa summi
66	abstinence (n.)	i sumnak
67	abstract (adj.)	tongh, hmuh, theih, khawh lomi thil; e.g. Love, hate, anger are abstract qualities = Dawtnak, huatnak, thinhunnak cu tongh, hmuh, theih khawh lomi thil an si.
68	abstruse (adj.)	hngalh harmi; e.g. This is an abstruse subject = Hihi cu hngalh harmi thil a si.
69	absurd (adj.)	nihchuak, zoh rem lo; e.g. His behavior (behaviour) is absurd = A ziaza nichuak a si.
70	absurdity (n.)	nihchuak sinak, zohchia sinak
71	abundance (n.)	tampi
72	abundant (adj.)	tling, duhdim; e.g. abundant life = nunnak duhdim
73	abuse (v.)	1. volhpamh; 2. ningcang loin hman; e.g. He abused his power = A nawlngeihnak kha ningcang loin a hman.
74	abusive (adj.)	volhpamh hmangmi; e.g. She uses abusive language = Volhpamh bia a hman lengmang.
75	abysmal (adj.)	a thuk tuk; e.g. His ignorance is abysmal = A hngalh lonak a thuk tuk.
76	abyss (n.)	dongh hngal lo khor thukpi
77	academic (adj.)	cawnnak lei he aa pehtlaimi; e.g. The academic year begins in June = Cawnnak lei kum cu June thla in aa thawk.
78	academy (n.)	cawnnak sang sianginn
79	accede (v.)	1. hnatlakpi; e.g. They acceeded to his proposal = A bia kha an hnatlakpi; 2. kai; e.g. When did he acceed to his position = Zeitik ah dah a umnak hmun ah hin a hung kai?
80	accelerate (v.)	a khul ranter
81	accelerator (n.)	khulrantertu, khulrang deuh in kal seh tinak caah mawttawka chung i dahsi tam deuh peknak
82	accent (n.)	awcawi
83	accentuate (v.)	fak khun deuh in chim
84	accept (v.)	cohlan
85	acceptable (adj.)	cohlan khawhmi
86	acceptance (n.)	cohlannak
87	access (n.)	luhnak lam
88	accessible (adj.)	luh hnawh khawhmi , ton khawhmi
89	accession (n.)	1. hmuh khawhmi; 2. bawi tthutnak hmun i hung kainak
90	accessory (n.)	a bawmtu, thil hmetuai deuh
91	accident (n.)	eksident, thil poipang ruah lopi i a hung ummi; e.g. The victims of the accident were mutilated, some lost arms, some lost legs = Eksident a tongmi hna kha an bultan dih, a cheu cu an kut a um lo, a cheu cu an ke a um lo; e.g. I suspect that an accident has delayed him = Eksident nih a tlaiter rua tiah ka ruah.
92	accidental (adj.)	ruah lopi ah sualpang a hung ummi
93	acclaim (v.)	thangtthat , cawimawi
94	acclimate (v.)	i nek
95	acclimatize (v.)	= acclimate; i nek.
96	accommodate (v.)	1. tlum, riahnak hmun pek; 2. ruahnak fonhtonh; e.g. We must accommodate to each other's ideas = Pakhat le pakhat ruahnak kan i fonhtonh awk a si.
97	accompaniment (n.)	thil dang he aa zulmi; e.g. They danced to the accompaniment of music = Aw dawh an tummi zulh in an lam.
98	accompany (v.)	zulh , kal tti , kalpi
99	accomplice (n.)	thil ttha lo tuah bawmtu
100	accomplish (v.)	tlinter , tuah khawh , lim, tuah khawh
101	accord (n.)	mahte hnatlaknak in, mah hnatla tein; e.g. He went there of his own accord = Amah hnatla tein a kal.
102	accordance (n.)	ning zulhnak
103	accordian (n.)	aw dawh tumnak akhawrdian
104	according (adv.)	ning zulh in
105	account (v.)	1. kong chim; e.g. He was asked to account for his conduct = A ziaza kong kha chim dingah an fial; 2. rel; e.g. In English law, a man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty = Mirang upadi ah cun mi cu, na sual, ti khawh hlanah cun sual lo ah rel a si.
106	account (n.)	tangka hmuhnak le hmannak cazin
107	accountable (adj.)	relpiak khawh; e.g. A madman is not accountable for his actions = A molhmi pa cu a tuahmi kha amah tuahmi ah relpiak khawh a si lo.
108	accountant (n.)	tangka cazin tlaitu
109	accredit (v.)	1. ram aiawhtu ah ramdang i ca he tling tein kalter; 2. zumh; e.g. Can we accredit his words = A bia cu kan zumh ko hnga maw?
110	accrue (v.)	mah tein rak tthan; e.g. If you keep money in the Savings Bank, interest accrues = Bank ah tangka na chiah ahcun a karh kha a rak tthang.
111	accumulate (v.)	karh, i chap chin lengmang
112	accuracy (n.)	hmannak
113	accurate (adj.)	hman (hmaan); e.g. You speak English accurately = Mirang holh hman tein na chim.
114	accuse (v.)	sual puh
115	accustom (v.)	i nek; e.g. He is accustomed to cold weather = Khuasik aa nek.
116	ace (n.)	a ttha bik, a thiam bikmi
117	acerbic (adj.)	bia chiakha
118	ache (n.)	fak; e.g. I have a toothache = Ka ha a fak.
119	achieve (v.)	tlinter , lim , hlawhtlin
120	achievement (n.)	tlinternak, hlawhtlinnak
121	acid (n.)	a thormi ti , esit
122	acidity (n.)	thornak; e.g. Lemon has a high degree of acidity = Theithu cu a thor ngaingai.
123	acknowledge (v.)	1. thil kuatmi ka hmuh cang tiah hngalhternak; 2. a si tak, tinak; e.g. We should acknowledge our faults = Kan palhnak cu a si tak tiah kan ti awk a si.
124	acknowledgment (n.)	theihter tthannak, lunglawmhnak theihter tthannak.
125	acme (n.)	a sannak bik
126	acorn (n.)	thilthing thei, kuhthing thei, farthing thei
127	acoustics (n.)	aw hrawlning; e.g. The acoustics of the hall is excellent = Khan chung aw hrawlning cu a ttha ngai.
128	acquaint (v.)	i theihngalh; e.g. I am not acquainted with him = Amah he kan i theihngal lo.
129	acquaintance (n.)	theihngalhmi; e.g. He is just an acquaintance = Amah cu ka theihngalh menmen a si.
130	acquiesce (v.)	alnak um lo i hnatlakpi; e.g. She wants to marry him, but her parents do not acquiese = Amah vat cu a duh ko, sihmanhsehlaw a nu le a pa nih an hnatlakpi lo.
131	acquire (v.)	ngeih, hawl khawh; e.g. He acquired a lot of money = Tangka tampi a ngei.
132	acquisition (n.)	ngeihnak, hawl khawhnak
133	acquit (v.)	a sual lo tiah biaceihnak in thanh
134	acre (n.)	eka, tungvang palh kaih 4840
135	acrid (adj.)	1. rimtler; e.g. The smell of burning feather is acrid = Arhmul kangh rim cu a tler; 2. ingthor, ingchia
136	acrimonious (adj.)	misual hawl lawng duh
137	acrobatic (n.)	perzuan thiam
138	Acropolis (n., prop.)	Hlan lo Grik mi nih an khua an rak kulhmi.
139	across (adv.)	tan , khattelei in khattelei ah
140	act (v.)	1. tuah, ttuan , tuah khawk; 2: mi nawl cawn.
141	acting (n.)	midang tuah hngami rak tuahpiak
142	action (n.)	cawlcangh
143	activate (v.)	cawlcanghter , thawkter
144	active (adj.)	rianttuan huam , thawhzang , thekvak ttha
145	activity (n.)	rian; e.g. School activities are carried out by students and teachers = Sianginn rian cu siangngakchia le sayate nih an tuah.
146	actor (n.)	baisikup tlangval
147	actress (n.)	baisikup ngaknu
148	actual (adj.)	a sining taktak, a simi taktak
149	actuality (n.)	a taktak
150	actually (adv.)	a ngaingai ti ahcun; e.g. He looks honest, actually he is a rogue = Miding a lo, a ngaingai ti ahcun mi hrokhrol a si.
151	acumen (n.)	thluak rannak, khulrang in thil hngalh khawh le thiam khawhnak
152	acupuncture (n.)	thim sawh in damternak, Tuluk thiam hmasami
153	acute (adj.)	a fak ngaimi
154	ad hoc (adj.)	herhpang; e.g. ad hoc committee = herhpang komiti
155	adage (n.)	phungthlukbia
156	adamant (adj.)	lung hak, lung bantukin a hakmi
157	adapt (v.)	i cawn , i lak , hawi sining i cawn
158	adaptable (adj.)	a herhnak bantukin um khawh, i cawn khawh, hman khawh
159	adaptation (n.)	i cawn khawhnak, i lak khawhnak, i hma khawhnak
160	add (v.)	fonh
161	addendum (n.)	hrelh sualmi chap tthanmi
162	adder (n.)	rul phun khat, a sivai a tthawng ngaimi.
163	addicted (adj.)	lem cang; e.g. He is addicted to smoking = Kuakzuk nih a lem cang i a thlah kho ti lo.
164	addition (n.)	fonhnak
165	additional (adj.)	chapmi
166	address (n.)	umnak hmun , biachimmi
167	addressee (n.)	cakuatmi minung khi
168	adept (n., adj.)	a thiam ngaingaimi; e.g. She is adept at weaving = Thiamtah a thiam ngaingai.
169	adequacy (n.)	zatnak
170	adequate (adj.)	aa za
171	adhere (v.)	i tlaih peng, i beh peng
172	adherence (n.)	i tlaih pengnak, i beh pengnak
173	adherent (n.)	tanpitu , zultu
174	adhesive (adj.)	benh khawhmi
175	adhesive (n.)	behnak thil bang
176	adieu (interj.)	dam tein
177	adjacent (adj.)	a changtu , a hun pehtu
178	adjective (n.)	thil kong a chimtu biafang; e.g. He is a good man = Amah cu mi 'ttha' a si. 'Ttha' hi adjective cu a si.
179	adjoin (v.)	peh, an i peh
180	adjourn (v.)	ngol ta rih
181	adjudge (v.)	upadi ningin biakhiah
182	adjunct (n.)	a bawmtu , a chapchuantu
183	adjust (v.)	mah ca ttha dingin mersam
184	adjustable (adj.)	mersan khawhmi , remh khawhmi
185	adjutant (n.)	ralbawi, an cung bawi aiawh in rian a ttuanmi, a tam bki cu captain an si.
186	administer (v.)	1. tuah; e.g. The Pastor administers the Lord's Supper = Pastor nih Bawipa Zanriah a tuah; 2. zohkhenh , uk; e.g. The Head Master administers the school = Head Master nih sianginn a zohkhenh (uk); 3. pek; e.g. The nurse administers the medicine = Sayama nih si a pek hna.
187	administration (n.)	uknak , zohkhenh , rianttuannak
188	administrator (n.)	zohkhenhtu , uktu , tuahtu
189	admirable (adj.)	duh awk tlak a simi, nawl cawn awk tlak a simi
190	admiral (n.)	tilawng ralkap bawi ngan bik
191	admire (v.)	duh , a ttha ti , aa dawh ti
192	admissible (adj.)	luhter khawhmi
193	admission (n.)	luhkhawhnak
194	admit (v.)	1. ka sual ko ti; e.g. He admitted his mistake = Ka palh ko a ti; 2. luhter, sianginn i luhter
195	admittance (n.)	luhternak
196	admixture (n.)	cawhmi chung i cawh chihmi
197	admonish (v.)	chimhhrin
198	admonition (n.)	chimhhrinnak
199	ado (n.)	hnahnawh lurit, phunzai; e.g. Without further ado he signed the agreement = Phunzai ti loin hnatlaknak kha a min a thut.
200	adobe (n.)	rawh lo i ni lawngin cartermi tlakrawh
201	adolescence (n.)	nu le pa kong theih hramthawk caan , tleirol
202	adolescent (n.)	tlangval , ngaknu
203	adopt (v.)	1. fa i canter; 2. i lak; e.g. We adopt the best method = Tuahning ttha bik kha kan i lak.
204	adoption (n.)	fa canter
205	adorable (adj.)	fak piin dawt i fak piin upat awk tlak a simi
206	adore (v.)	fak piin duh i fak piin upat
207	adorn (v.)	thuamh , ttamh
208	adornment (n.)	thuamhnak , ttamhnak
209	adrift (adj.)	thlichia le tilet nih an duhnak paoh i tilawng an fenh khi, hrihhram ngeih lo
210	adroit (adj.)	thiam, fim; e.g. He is an adroit speaker = Biachim thiam ngaimi a si.
211	adroitness (n.)	thiamnak, fimnak
212	adulate (v.)	fak , ka daw seh ti duh i fak
213	adult (adj.)	upa , patling , nutling
214	adulterate (v.)	thurhnawmhter , a ttha lomi thil cawh chih.
215	adulterer (n.)	nu (pa) sin i a sualmipa
216	adulteress (n.)	pa sin i a sualminu
217	adultery (n.)	vacung pa duh , nu duh , pa duh
218	advance (v.)	1. hmailei kal; e.g. The troops advanced two miles = Ralkap cu hmailei ah khan hnih an kal; 2. cung kai; e.g. He worked so well that he was advanced to the post of a manager = A rianttuan a tthat caah maneizar rian ah a kai; 3. pek chung; e.g. I advanced him two kyats = Tangka phar hnih ka pek chung.
219	advancement (n.)	hmailei kalnak
220	advantage (n.)	tthathnemnak; e.g. What is the advantage of having a house = Inn ngeih cu zei tthathnemnak dah a um?
221	advent (n.)	rat; e.g. Since the advent of jet planes, travel has been speeded up = Jet vanlawng rat (hung chuah) hnu cun, khualtlawn rian a rang deuh; e.g. Bawi Jesuh rat tthannak.
222	Adventism (n., prop.)	Jesuh a ttum tthan zau lai tiah zumhnak.
223	Adventists (n., prop.)	Jesuh a ttum tthan zau lai tiah a zummi pawl.
224	adventure (n.)	kal bal lonak ram le ttih a nungmi hmun i va kal
225	adventurer (n.)	kal bal lonak ram le ttih a nungmi hmun i a va kal mipa
226	adventuress (n.)	kal bal lonak ram le ttih a nungmi hmun i a va kal minu
227	adverb (n.)	riantuantu biafang; e.g. Verb a bawmtu bia; He ran quickly = Khulrang tein a tli. QUICKLY = 'rang tein' ti biafang hi adverb cu a si, zeicahtiah 'tli' ti biafang kha a fianter chin i a bawmh.
228	adversary (n.)	ral; e.g. He is not my adversary = Amah cu ka ral a si lo.
229	adverse (adj.)	mah ca ttha lomi , harnak ton; e.g. Adverse circumstances caused him to lose all his money = A ca i a ttha lomi thil umtuning nih a tangka vialte a sunghter.
230	adversity (n.)	harnak tonmi , mah ca ttha lomi thil tonmi
231	advertise (v.)	thawngthanh , mi theihter , ca in siseh , hmanthlak in siseh
232	advertisement (n.)	thawngthanhnak tuahmi
233	advice (n.)	fim chimhnak , lungthin cheuh
234	advise (v.)	lungthin cheuh , fim chimh
235	adviser (n.)	lungthin cheutu , fim chimtu
236	advisory (adj.)	ruahnak pek; e.g. advisory body = ruahnak petu bu
237	advocacy (n.)	ttanhnak, chimpiak, dirkamh
238	advocate (v.)	tanh, chimpiak; e.g. We advocate peace = Daihnak kan tanh.
239	advocate (n.)	ttanhtu , chimpiaktu , dirkamhtu
240	aeon (n.)	rel cawk lo kum a raumi caan saupi
241	aerate (v.)	thli i canter, thli luhter
242	aerial (n.)	radio hri zammi.
243	aeroplane (n.)	vanlawng

245	affable (adj.)	komh nuammi mittha
246	affair (n.)	rian, kong
247	affect (v.)	thlen, umtuning danter; e.g. Weather can affect crops = Nikhua nih rawl kung umtuning a danter khawh.
248	affection (n.)	hawikom dawtnak
249	affectionate (adj.)	dawt ngaimi; e.g. Your affectionate friend = Na dawt ngaimi na hawi
250	affidavit (n.)	Biaceihtu bawi hmaiah chiatser in chimmi bia
251	affiliate (v.)	a tengnge rak si, i peh; e.g. This college is affiliated to (with) the university = Hi college hi university tengnge a si; Hi college hi university he aa peh.
252	affiliation (n.)	i pehtlaihnak; a lain deuhmi bu he i pehtlaihnak
253	affinity (n.)	pehtlaihnak ; i lawhnak, i banghnak
254	affirm (v.)	a hman a dik hrimhrim ti i chim , ttial
255	affirmative (adj.)	a si ti in leh , a hman ti in leh
256	affix (v.)	benh, fonh; e.g. Affix the stamp on the envelope = Ca-ik ah milu benh.
257	afflict (v.)	nganfah pek, harnak pek; e.g. There are many illnesses which afflict old people = Tar pawl nganfah a petuzawtnak tampi a um.
258	affliction (n.)	nganfah peknak , harnak peknak
259	affluence (n.)	rumnak , duhdim te i nunnak
260	affluent (adj.)	thilri tampi ngeih, mirum si; e.g. He is an affluent person = Amah cu mirum a si.
261	afford (v.)	cawknak man ngeih khawh; e.g. I can afford to buy a car = Mawttaw cawknak tangka ka ngei kho.
262	afire (adj.)	a kang hluahmahmi; e.g. Bush afire = A kang hluahmahmi burbuk
263	afloat (adj., adv.)	ti cungah siseh, thli cungah siseh, a lao, aa vuan; e.g. The boat was afloat on the water = Tilawng cu ti cungah aa lao.
264	afraid (adj.)	ttih; e.g. I am afraid of tigers = Cakei ka ttih hna.
265	afresh (adv.)	a thar in tuah tthan; e.g. We painted the room afresh = Innkhan kha a thar in si kan
266	after (prep.)	hnu ah
267	afterlife (n.)	thih hnu nunnak, nuncang hmuhnak

269	afternoon (n.)	chunhnu
270	afterward (n.)	hmailei caan ah

280	aggrandize (v.)	nawlngeihnak le rumnak i ngan chinchin, a puanpar i rumra ngei ngai i um

282	aggregate (adj.)	a dihlak tuak ah; e.g. The aggregate sum of his debts was K.300 = A leiba a dihlak tuak ah K.300 a si.
283	aggression (n.)	midang cung i zaang-ennak va tuah ; midang va doh le va thah
284	aggressive (adj.)	1. midang va doh le thah a duhmi, midang he bia al a duh ngai i amah duhning in mi dang umter a duhmi; 2. rianttuan huammi, mi hruai kho
285	aggressor (n.)	midang ram a va dohtu
286	agile (adj.)	khulrang, fel, fawi tein cawlcangh, ruang-ai; e.g. Cats are very agile = Chizawh cu an ruang a ai ngai.

495	anxiously (adv.)	lungrethei ngaiin
496	any (adj.)	1. zeizat ti set a um lomi; e.g. Do you have any money = Tangka zeital na ngei maw? 2. kha set ti theng um lomi; e.g. Take any book you like = Na duhmi cauk paoh kha i lak; 3. tlawmpal in; e.g. Do you want any cream in your coffee = Na kawfi chungah cawhnuk kham tlawmpal in na duh maw? 4. zeipaoh; e.g. He can answer any question = Biahalnak zeipaoh a leh khawh.
497	any (adv.)	hlei maw; e.g. Is the patient any better = Mizaw cu a ttha deuh hlei maw?

513	appall (v., adj.)	a chia lei in khuaruahhar in um, khuaruahharter, lungdonghter; e.g. Her conduct appalled me = A umtu nih ka khuaruah a ka harter, ka lung a ka donghter.
514	apparatus (n.)	thilri; e.g. We have no heating apparatus = Tisa lumnak thilri kan ngei lo.

516	apparent (adj.)	a fiang, fiangin a lang

518	appeal (v.)	1. nawl; e.g. People appealed to us to help the poor = Misifak bawmh kha an kan nawl; 2. mi lungthin lak khawh; e.g. His ideas do not appeal to young people = A ruahnak nih mino cu an lungthin a la kho hna lo; 3.azukhan; e.g. He appealed to a higher court = Biaceihnak zung sang deuh ah azu a khan.
519	appear (v.)	1. mithmai i hung langh; e.g. He appears to be happy = Lunglawm in a mithmai a lang; 2. a hung chuak; e.g. He appeared from the jungle = Ramlak in a hung chuak; 3. zapi hmai a hung chuah

542	approach (v.)	1. fuh; e.g. The car approached the town = Mawttawka nih khuapi kha a fuh; 2. fuhpanh, nawlpat
543	approachable (adj.)	ton fawimi, hawikom ttha
544	appropriate (adj.)	aa tlakmi, aa rupmi; e.g. He made a speech appropriate to the occasion = A caan le a hmun he aa tlakin bia a chim.
545	appropriate (v.)	hman awk ding i tangka chiah; e.g. The government appropriated money for the new school = Acozah nih sianginn thar ca hman awkah tangka an chiah.

624	as (adv.)	1. tluk; e.g. She is as pretty as her mother = A nu tluk in aa dawh. 2. tahchunhnak ah, bantuk; e.g. Some work as carpentry is very tiresome = Lehtama rian bantuk hna hi rian har a si; as far as, so far as = tiangah; e.g. As far as I know = Ka hngalh tiangah; just as well; e.g. Since our friends didn't turn up, we may just as well go home = Kan hawile an rat lo caah inn i kan kir zongah a ttha ko lai; e.g. Our fishing expedition was ruined by bad weather. We might just as well have stayed at home = Kan tiva kal cu ruahpi nih a kan rawk, inn ah khan rak um deuh awk men kan rak si. as well as – e.g. He gave me rice as well as salt = Facang a ka pek i cite zong a ka pek chih.
625	as (conj.)	1. caah; e.g. As you do not like chilies, I am not going to give you any = Makphek na duh lo caah kan pe lai lo; e.g. As you are busy now, I shall come later = Atu cu naa manh lo caah hnu deuh ah ka ra te lai. 2. tahchunh-nak; e.g. Asian countries, such as Myanmar, India = Asia ram pawl, tahchunhnak ah Kawlram, India hei ti bantuk; 3. bantukin; e.g. Why is he dressed as a woman = Zeicahdah nu bantukin aa thuamh?; 4. lioah; e.g. As a boy, he lived in Yangon = A ngakchiat lioah Yangon ah a rak um. as good as = A dih tluk a si ko, aa lim dengmang;
626	as (pron.)	ttuanmi; e.g. He is working as a clerk = Cazi rian a ttuan.
627	asbestos (n.)	1. inncung cihnak ca hmanmi thil phun khat; 2. mei khang khawh lomi puan phun khat

687	at (prep.)	ah; e.g. at the station = tlanglawng dinhnak hmun ah; e.g. at noon = chun ah; e.g. at home = inn ah. at any rate: a zei a si hmanh ah at that rate: cuning ahcun, chukhan ahcun, cuti a si ahcun at hand = pawngte i um peng; at heart = lungchung ah; at intervals = atu le atu, hika, khika ah. at most, at the most: a tam bik ah; e.g. At most five of us will go = A tam bik ah panga kan kal lai. at the insistence of = nawl ruangah; e.g. At the insistence of the boy I accompanied him to his home = Ngakchiapa nih a ka nawl ruangah a inn tiang ka hei kalpi.

1384	break (v.)	1. kuai; 2. let; e.g. He never breaks his promise = A biakam a let bal lo; 3. buar; e.g. Those who broke the law are punished = Nawl a buarmi cu dan an tat hna; 4. hranhram in luh, chuah; e.g. A thief broke into the house = Mifir inn chungah a lut; e.g. He broke loose from prison = Thong chung in a zam (chuak). break down = rawk break loose = zam, luat; e.g. He broke loose from prison = Thonginn in a zam. break off = ngol. break up = ngolternak, donghternak.

1756	case (n.)	1. thil a hung ummi; e.g. Only one case of robbery was reported to the police = Fir a hung ummi pakhat lawng palik sihan an thanh; 2. bia; e.g. The judge decided the case = Biaceihtu nih bia a khiah; 3. Harnak zawtnak a ingmi; e.g. The doctor treated cases of dysentery = Sibawipa nih thisen thletmi a zohkhenh hna; 4. kuang; e.g. book case = cauk kuang; e.g. tea case = lakphak kuang. in case = a si sual ahcun; e.g. Bring your umbrella in case it rains = Ruah a sur sual ai, na nithawng i put. in any case = a zeiti lei hmanh in; e.g. In any case, you will have to go = A zeiti lei hmanh in na kai a herh ko lai.

Catch the ball = Pumpululh kha tlai. 3. sio; e.g. How many fish did you catch = Nga zeizatdah na sio? 4. zawt; e.g. I catch cold easily = Cumpi in fawi tein ka zaw. catch up with = e.g. Walk slowly and I will catch up with you = Duhsah tein rak kal law ka hun in phak ko lai. catch fire = kangh aa thawk.

1893	character (n.)	1. ziaza, sining; e.g. His character is good = A ziaza a ttha. 2. Drama chung maw asiloah tuanbia chung i minung; e.g. The most important character in the story is a young doctor = Tuanbia chung i a biapi bikmi a simi cu sibawi note kha a si. 3. hawi lo deuh lo, nihchuak deuh a simi; e.g. The old man was a character in the village = Tarpa cu an khua chungah khan hawi lo lo deuh a si.
1894	characteristic (n.)	hawi dang he i lawh lonak mah siningte a langhtertu
1895	characteristically (adv.)	amah sining a langhning tein
1896	characterization (n.)	a zia ningte kha langhternak
1897	characterize (v.)	ziaza ningte langhter
1898	charcoal (n.)	meihol
1899	charge (v.)	1. man chiah; e.g. How much do you charge for this bread = Hi changreu hi a man zeizatdah na hauh? 2. rawn, meithal chung zen rawn; 3. hmailei i choi cutmat; e.g. He charged toward the door to escape = Zam awkah innka lei ah a choi cutmat; 4. sual puh; e.g. They charged him with murder = Lainawn an puh; 5. Charge it to my account = Keimah cham awkah rak chia.
1900	charge (n.)	1. sual puhnak; e.g. A criminal charge has been made against him = Ziaza tthatlo sualnak kha an puh; 2. zohkhenh-nak, tavuan; e.g. The books in the library are under his charge = Libray i cauk hna cu amah zohkhenhmi an si; 3. man; e.g. Their charge for the food was high = An rawl man huahmi a sang; 4. elektric tha; e.g. Electric charge is conducted by wire = Elektrik tha cu thirhri in kalpi a si. in charge of = zoh khenhtu.
1901	chargeable (adj.)	Sual puh khawh; e.g If you take somebody's money, you are chargeable with theft = Mi dang tangka na lak aheun fir puh khawh na si.

1910	charter (n.)	1. uktu bawi nih asiloah utubu nih thil tuah khawhnak caah nawl an peknak ca; e.g. The charter permits the bank to open an office in London = Nawl peknak ca nih hi bengh (bank) cu London khua ah zung phonhnak nawl a pek; 2. rianttuantubu pakhatkhat duhnak le tinhmi aa ttialnak ca; e.g. United Nations Charter.
1911	charter (v.)	1. nawlngeihnak he fehter; e.g. The Serampore College was chartered in the 19th century = Serampore College cu kum zabu hleikua chungah khan fehter a si. 2. hlan; e.g. They chartered a plane = Vanlawng pakhat a ningpi in an hlan.

2745	credit (n.)	1. ahmaan ti i zumh; e.g. He put credit in what they said = An chimmi bia kha ahmaan tiah a zumh; 2. upatnak, thangtthatnak; e.g. The boy received credit for his hard work = Ngakchia nih fak piin aa zuammi rian ah khan thangtthatnak a hmuh; 3. bank i tangka chiahmi a tang rihmi; e.g. His bank balance shows a credit = Bank i a tangka chiahmi a tangmi a um rih. on credit = a ba in.
2746	credit (v.)	1. a hmaan tiah zumh; e.g. She did not credit the boy's story = Ngakchiapa chimmi kha a zum lo; 2. tangka chiahmi i rak fonhpiak; e.g. The bank credited the deposit to his account = Bank tangka a chiahmi cu a cazin ah khan an fonhpiak; 3. a siter, a canter ti i ruah; e.g. The old man credited his long life to good habits = Tarpa nih saupi ka nun hi ziaza ttha in ka nun caah a si tiah a ruah. credit someone with = upatnak pek.

2827	crystal (n.)	1. tleng lakin hmuh khawhmi thil, hawhra tlang a lomi; 2. a tlang tete a simi; e.g. The crystals of snow = Hawhra tlang tete
2828	crystal (adj.)	tliangte i sermi, fim dildelte i a ummi
2829	crystalize (v.)	1. a tlang tete i hun i can; e.g. The melted sugar crystalized on the fruit = A timi thanthling cu thei cungah khan a tlang tete ah a hun i cang; 2. thil ah a hun can; e.g. His plans crystalized into action = A khuakhanmi khatuahmi thil ah an hun i cang; 3. lungchuntg i fiang ngaiin hun hngalh

2878	cut (v.)	1. at, tuk; e.g. He cuts himself while shaving = A hmurhmul aa meh lioah aa at; 2. riam, tan; e.g. He cut the grass = Ram a riam; 3. tthumh; e.g. He cut his expenses = A tangka hmanmi a tthumh. Past tense and past participle of cut is cut. cut back = Tawiter, tthumh; cut in = Rak i thlak ve e.g. He cut in on their conversation = An biaruahnak ah a ak i thlak ve i a tan hna; cut short = Dih lo i ngol; e.g. He cut short his trip = A khual tlawn dih loin a ngol. cut teeth = Ha keuh.

2929	date (n.)	1. caan, nithla; e.g. 1492 is the date of the discovery of America = 1492 kum kha America an rak hmuh nithla a si; 2. hawikom ngaknu tlangval i len; 3. deih thei.

2955	deal (n.)	1. a tlawm a tamning; e.g. A great deal of his money was spent for food = A tangka a tam deuh cu rawl caah a hman. 2. pakhat le pakhat ca tthathnemnak ding cio i tuahmi le khanmi, chawlehthalnak lei ah siseh, nainganzi lei ah siseh
2956	deal (v.)	1. i phawtzamh cio; 2. i biakchonh i tita; e.g. It is very difficult to deal with him = Amah he i tita cu a har ngai; 3. phekahnak ca i phawt cio; 4. cawk, zorh; e.g. This shop deals in petrol and kerosine = Hi dawr hi petrol le zinan a caw a zuarmi an si; 5. pakhat le pakhat i pek; e.g. One fighter dealt the other a severe blow = Thongh thiam pakhat nih a dang pakhat kha fak piin a thongh; 6. thingah, pe 6 sau, lehmah 7 kau, lehmah 3 tluk chah pawl.
2957	dealer (n.)	thil a caw i a zuartu
2958	dealing (n.)	chaw tuahtauning, mi he i pehtlaihning; e.g. He is honoured (honored) for his fair dealing with others = Mi he an i pehtlaihning a tthat caah amah cu an hmaizah.
2959	dean (n.)	1. Khrihfabu chung i upa ngaingai a simi; e.g. Biakinn nganpi pakhat chung i a lu bik a si; 2. college siangakchia a zohkhenhtu hna, an ziaza le an cawn ding a tuaktanpitu hna, saya nganpi.
2960	dear (adj.)	1. dawtmi; 2. a man a sangmi; e.g. The price of this book is very dear = Hi cauk man cu a sang ngaingai.
2961	dear (interj.)	aize, maw ka thin; e.g. Alas, Oh dear! = Aize, Maw ka thin!
2962	dearly (adv.)	1. dawt ngaiin; 2. man fak ngaiin cawk
2963	dearness (n.)	thil man fahnak; e.g. Dearness allowance = Thil man fah ruang i a hlei in tangka an pekmi hna
2964	death (n.)	thihnak

2966	debar (v.)	onh lo , nawl pek lo

2972	debauch (v.)	ziaza tthatnak lei in chiatnak lei i kalpi; pumsa nuamhnak in asiloah eidinnak in ziaza hrawh; e.g. Bad companions had debauched the boy = Tlangval no cu hawikom tthalo nih chiatnak ah an kalpi.
2973	debauchery (n.)	pumsa nuamhnak i a hleihluat in um tuk, din einak lei ah a si khun
2974	debenture (n.)	lei kan bat tinak lehhmah; ram dang in thil a cah i ram dang ah zuar tthantu sinah, cozah nih, ram chung luh man an akmi tangka lehhmah; e.g. England ram in mawttawka tangka thong sawm nga in hei caw ning law, cu mawttawka cu Kawlram i a luh man ah tangka thong kul Kawl cozah nih hei ka la hna sehlaw, cu mawttawka cu India ah hei zuar tthan ning law, cu mawttawka Kawlram luh man i tangka thong kul an ka lakmi kha India i na zuar tthan caah kan in khirh tthan lai tiah bia an ka kamnak lehhmah debenture cu a si.
2975	debit (n.)	cawimi tangka leiba
2976	debit (v.)	leiba lei i chiah , zuh; e.g. Debit my account K.100 = Ka tangka chung khan K. 100/- zuk tuah.

2978	debt (n.)	leiba; e.g. I am in debt = Leiba ka ngei.

2981	decade (n.)	kum hra bu; e.g. One decade = Kum hra bu bu khat

2986	decay (v.)	1. thut; e.g. Old fruits decay = Thei hlun cu an thu; 2. ttumchuk; e.g. Our physical power decays in old age = Tar tikah kan pum thazang a ttumchuk.
2987	decease (v.)	thih

2998	decide (v.)	bia i khiah , lung i thleh
2999	deciduous (adj.)	thingkung a hnah a thil phun a simi; e.g. Apple is a deciduous tree = Epal cu hnah thil phun a si.
3000	decimal (n.)	pahra lengmang in tthenmi nambar
3001	decimate (v.)	tampi thah , hrawh; e.g. A plague had decimated the population = Plek rai nih an bu chungin tampi a thah hna.
3002	decipher (v.)	mi dang nih hngal hna hlah seh tiin ttialmi ca a sullam vun langhter, hlanliopi hawi hna i an rak ttialmi ca mi sawsawh nih a sullam hngalh lomi le rel khawh lomi vun fianter
3003	decision (n.)	biakhiahnak

3005	deck (n.)	1. tilawng innleng; 2. phethuk
3006	declare (v.)	thanh , chim
3007	decline (v.)	1. al, duh lo; e.g. He declined my invitation to dinner = Zanriah ei ka sawmmi cu a ka al; 2. ttumchuk; e.g. His health is in decline = A ngandamnak a ttumchuk; 3. a vung niam zuahmah; e.g. The high hill declines to a valley = Tlang sangpi cu nelrawn ah khan a vung niam zuahmah.
3008	decline (n.)	ttumchuknak; e.g. The decline of the Roman Empire.
3009	decompose (v.)	thut i taksa i tthen dih
3010	decorate (v.)	1.ttamh; e.g. Inn ttamh 2. mintthat pek; e.g. The king decorated a brave soldier = Siangpahrang nih ralkap kha mintthatnak a pek.

3012	decoy (n.)	hlennak i tuahmi thil, lem khawhnak ding ca i tuahmi hlennak; e.g. Wooden decoy for ducks = Compai he aa lo in sermi thing compai.

3020	deduction (n.)	zuhnak
3021	deed (n.)	1. tuahmi; e.g. His words and his deeds do not agree = A bia le a tuahmi an i khat lo; 2. ngeitu sinak ca; e.g. After he paid for the house, he was given a deed to it = Inn man a pek dih in ngeitu sinak ca kha an pek.
3022	deem (v.)	zumh , ruah
3023	deep (adj.)	thuk; e.g. The sea is deep = Rili cu a thuk; The box is 3 feet wide and 2 feet deep = Thingkuang cu pe 3 a kau i pe 2 a thuk; e.g He has a deep voice = A aw a thum ngai.

3380	direct (adj.)	1. ding teomao tein; e.g. A bee makes a direct flight to the hive = Khuai cu ding teomao tein a bu ah a zuang; 2. a karlak ah ahohmanh um lo; e.g. He is in direct contact with the teacher = Amah cu sayapa he an karlak ah ahohmanh um loin an i tong; 3. piang tein, velhui lo tein; e.g. Please give me a direct answer = Lehnak a piangmi te ka pe. .

3519	dispose (v.)	1. umter; e.g. The ships were disposed in a straight line = Tilawng cu artlang tein an umter hna; 2. duhter; e.g. The good pay disposed him to take the job = Lahkhah ttha nih khan rian ku lak a duhter; 3. duh, hnatlak; e.g. He is disposed to grant your request = Na halmi pek cu an duh ko. dispose of = ti cu hlonh asiloah zuar tinak a si; e.g. Dispose of that rubbish = Khi hnawm khi hei hlonh hna; e.g. He disposed of all his properties = A thil vialte a zuar dihhna.
3520	disposition (n.)	1. chuahpimi lung thin lungput; e.g. He has a cheerful disposition = Milunglawm phun a si; 2. ningcang tein thil chiah; 3. biachahnak; e.g. What disposition of John's case did you make = John bia kha zeitindah nan chah?; 4. zuar; e.g. He made a disposition of his goods = Athil a zuar hna.

3596	divinity (n.)	Pathian sinak

3598	divisible (adj.)	tthen khawh , cheu khawh , phawt khawh a simi
3599	division (n.)	tthennak, cheunak, phawtnak, district nakin a ngan deuhni peng.
3600	divisor (n.)	phawtu; e.g. 728 kha 16 in phawt tikah 16 kha phawtu cu a si
3601	divorce (v.)	1. nupi mak , va kirtak; 2. tthen
3602	dizziness (n.)	lungmihnak
3603	dizzy (adj.)	lungmit in um; e.g. I am dizzy = Ka lung a mit.
3604	do (v.)	1. tuah; e.g. Do your work well = Na rian ttha tein tuah; ttuan; 2. zuam; e.g. Do your best = Fakpi in i zuam; 3. a zat ko lai; e.g. This coat will do for the winter = Hi angki nih hin khuasik cu an zaat ko lai; 4. tthathnem; e.g. A rest will do you good = Dinh nih an tthathnem lai; 5. Zeitindah na um = How do you do? (How are you?); Do nih ihn sullam set a ngeih lo chel a um; e.g. Do you like eggs = Arti na duh maw = Fak deuh in chim duh tikah hman a si?; e.g. I do like potatoes = Aalu ka duh taktak. have to do with = ka tuah awk a si. do away with = hlawt. do away with = ei lo i um make do = tlintlam lo bu zong i tuah peng i zuam; e.g. I shall have to make my old clothes do for this winter = Tutan khuasik chung cu ka thilpuan hlun kha an tlamtlin lo buin ka hman peng hna a hau ko lai.
3605	docile (adj.)	nawl ngaimi, cawnpiak a fawimi
3606	docility (n.)	nawl ngaimi sinak
3607	dock (n.)	tilawng dinhnak i hmun pakhat a si i cuka i tilawng aa din tikah thil chuahnak le chonhnak hmun ah hman a si. Cun tilawng remhnak hmun zongah hman a si fawn i duh ah ti kha luhter khawh, duh ah chuahter i roter khawhmi hmun a si
3608	dock (v.)	dinh; e.g. The ship docked at Yangon port = Tilawng cu Yangon tilawng dinhnak ah aa din.
3609	dockyard (n.)	tilawng sernak hmun , remhnak hmun
3610	doctor (n.)	1. sibawi; 2. cawnnak lei i a sang bik
3611	doctrinal (adj.)	zumhnak lei kong i cawnpiaknak he aa pehtlaimi
3612	doctrine (n.)	zumhnak lei kong i cawnpiaknak
3613	document (n.)	kut in siseh seh in siseh ttialmi ca , thil pakhatkhat kong ah siseh aa ttialnak; e.g. Birth, marriage and death certificates are documents = Chuah, nupi tthit le thihnak lehmah cu documents an si.
3614	document (v.)	ca ttialmi bia kha a si hrimhrim tinak caah cuka ca ttial chungah a um tiin fianter khawhnak
3615	documentary (adj.)	cattialmi he aa pehtlaimi; e.g. documentary evidence = Ca in aa ttialmi fiantertu tehte
3616	dodge (v.)	hlen, pumpululh chuih i i hlen khi
3617	does (v.)	do zoh; a 3rd person present indicative of do; e.g. He does. She does. It does. e.g. Hockey does not interest me = Hockey nih ka mit a ka la lo.
3618	dog (n.)	uico

3670	down (adv.)	1. a sannak in a niamnak ah; e.g. He was down in the cave = Lungkua chungah a vung lut; 2. ttum; e.g. The price of rice is down this month = Tu thla cu facang man a ttum; 3. phaisa a man pek colh; e.g. You can buy it for five kyats down = Tangka fang nga pek colh (kut humh) in na cawk khawh.

A hmuh awk a simi a tuanman kha thaizing ah pek awk a si lai; 2. aa tlakmi , a hmaanmi , a tthami; e.g. In due course = caan ttha caan hmaan a si tikah; 3. a phanh lai can ruah; e.g. When is the plane due = Vanlawng cu zeitikdah phak lai? due to = ti cu ruangah, ti a si

4454	expert (adj.)	a thiam ngaingaimi; e.g. He is an expert teacher = Cawnpiaktu thiam ngaingai a si.

4462	explicit (adj.)	piang tein chimmi
4463	explode (v.)	a puak, bomb a puak.
4464	exploit (n.)	ralttha ngaiin tuahmi thil e.g. A soldier was decorated for his exploits = Ralkap cu ralttha ngaiin a tuahmi thil caah mintthat an pek.
4465	exploit (v.)	1. hman; e.g. A mine is exploited for its minerals = A chung i thirdar a ummi laknak caah khor cu an hman; 2. ram pakhatkhat nih maw, mi pakhat nih maw amah ca tthathnemnak ca i mi dang ram le phun an hman hna khi exploit a si; e.g. Slaves were exploited by their masters = Sal cu an bawile nih an hman hna.
4466	exploitation (n.)	hmannak

4485	express (adj.)	a fiangmi; e.g. It was his express wish that we should go with him = A duhmi a fiangmi cu amah tel loin kannih kal kha a si, a rangmi; e.g. Express train = A rangmi tlanglawng

4511	extract (v.)	1. phawi, ha phawi; 2. a chungin lak; e.g. Can you extract the watch from my pocket = Ka zal chungin suimilam na la kho hnga maw? 3. a biapi bikmi lak; e.g. Try to extract the main points = A biapi bikmi lak i zuam.

4514	extradite (v.)	mah i rak humzualmi mi dang sin i pek tthan, cozah pakhat nih ram dang in a hung vakvaimi a rak zohkhenhmi hna an cozah sin i a kuat tthan hna khi.

4519	extreme (adj.)	1. tuk , lehpek , hringhran; e.g. He uses extreme care when driving in the rain = ruah sur i mawttaw a mongh ahcun aa ralring hringhran; 2. a donghnak bik ah; e.g. He lives in the house at the extreme end of the road = Lam a donghnak bik inn ah khan a um; 3. khattelei donghnak in khattelei donghnak; e.g. The weather went from one extreme to another = Nikhua cu khattelei donghnak in khattelei donghnak tiang a phan; a kih ah kik tuk, a lum ah a lum tuk.

4521	extremist (n.)	a lehpek a simi

4556	faculty (n.)	1. kan pum nih a ngeihmi thil ti khawhnak; e.g. Hearing is a faculty = Theihnak hi kan pum nih a ngeihmi thil ti khawhnak pakhat a si; 2. sianginn ah siseh, college ah siseh chimtu saya pawl; 3. university i cawnmi phun; e.g. Faculty of theology = Pathian lei kong cawnnak.

4560	Fahrenheit (n., prop.)	kih lum tahnak, dikiri 32 ah ti a khal, 212 ah ti a tlok.
4561	fail (v.)	1. sungh; e.g. He failed his exam = A camipuai a sung; 2. tlolh; e.g. She failed to answer the letter = Cakuat leh a tlolh; 3. deuh; e.g. He failed us when we needed him most = Kan herh bik caan ah a kan deuh; 4. a ttumchuk; His health has been failing = A damnak a ttumchuk chin lengmang. without fail = pel lo tein.
4562	failure (n.)	sunghnak
4563	faint (v.)	lungmih i zei hngal loin um

4566	fair (adj.)	1. a dinning le a phung ningin tuahmi; e.g. It was a fair fight = Boksing an i thongh cu a phungning le a dinning in an i thawng ko; 2. a za ko, a chia lo; e.g. His knowledge of English is fair = Mirang holh a thiamning cu a za ko, a chia lo; 3. ngo; e.g. She has a fair skin = a cuar a ngo, mingo a si; 4. khua a ttha; e.g. The weather is fair today = Nihin cu khua a ttha; 5. palh lo tein ttial thanmi; e.g. Make a fair copy of the letter = Cakuat kha palh lo tein ttial tthan.

4582	fall (v.)	1. tla; e.g. He fell from the roof = Inncung in a tla; 2. tlu; e.g. A baby falls when learning how to walk = Bawhte cu kal a cawn lioah a tlu lengmang; 3. ziaza lei tlu; e.g. He was tempted and fell = Tukforhnak a ing i a tlu; 4. tla, tluk, rawk; e.g. The city fell into the hands of the enemies = Khuapi cu ral kut chungah a tla; e.g. Rome fell = Rom khuapi cu a tlu, a rawk; 5. thi; e.g. Many fell in battle = Raltuknak hmun ah tampi an thi; 6. si; e.g. He fell ill = A zaw; e.g. They fell asleep = An i hngilh; e.g. They fell in love = An i duh; 7. paihsual; e.g. A boy fell among thieves = Ngakchiapa cu mifir lakah aa paihsual; 8. caan a tling; e.g. Christmas falls on Saturday = Khrismas ni cu zarhteni ah a tla; e.g. The interest on the money falls due in May = Tangka karh kha May thla ah a caan a tling lai; 9. cung tlun, tlen hnawh; e.g. The choice falls on you = Nangmah an in thim; 10. a si tikah; e.g. When night falls = Zan a si tikah; 11. man ttum; e.g. The price of oil has fallen = Chiti man a ttum cang; 12. zor; e.g. Water in the river has fallen two feet = Tiva chung ti pe hnih a ttum; 13. cheu, tthen; e.g. His story falls into two parts = A tuanbia cu cheu hnih ah aa tthen; 14. niam zuahmah; e.g. The land falls away here to the river = Vawlei cu hika hin tiva tiang a niam zuahmah; 15. chuak; e.g. Words fell from his lips = A hmurka in bia an chuak; 16. khawn, den; e.g. Where did the blow fall = An i thongh ah khan khuazei ah dah a khen? 17. sur; e.g. The rain falls = Ruah a sur. fall back = hnulei kir. fall back on = bochan tthan, i rinh tthan, i hngatchan tthan. fall behind = hawi phak lo. fall off = a tlinh; fall in love = an i dug kho lo; fall through = a tling kho lo; e.g. Her plan fell through = Aa tinh mi a tling kho lo.
4583	fall (n.)	1. tlaknak; e.g. The fall from his horse hurt him = Rang cungin a tlaknak nih a khawnden; 2. ruah sur; e.g. The fall of the rain was heavy = Ruah a tuk ngai; 3. tiva a kuang a ttum; e.g. The fall of the river begins here = Hika an hin tiva ttum hram aa thawk; 4. tthal le khuasik karlak; e.g. September le October hrawng, sikpar; 5. man tum; e.g. The fall of prices was slow = Thil man ttum a nuar ko. waterfall = tisor. Fall nih sullam dangdang a ngeihmi;

4618	far (adv.)	a hla; e.g.He lives far from here = Hika hin lamhlapi ah a um, a si deuh ngaingai; e.g. He is a far better writer than his brother = Amah cu a nau nakin cattial a thiam deuh ngaingaimi a si. as far as, so far as = tiangah; e.g. As far as I know = Ka hngalh tiangah; by far, far and away = tampi thlau, suaumau; e.g. He is far and away the better writer = Amah cu cattial a thiam deuh suaumau. so far, thus far = atu tiangah, cu tiangah.
4619	far (adj.)	a nai lomi, a hlami; e.g. He came from a far country = Ram hlapi in a ra, a hlat deuhnak hmun; e.g. He lives on the far side of the mountain = Tlang, khattelei kam, a hlat deuhnak ah khan a um.

4646	fast (adj.)	1. khul a rangmi; 2. caan a rangmi; e.g. His watch is fast = A suimilam a rang; 3. a muia chuak lo; e.g. fast color (colour) = Suk zong i a mui a chuak lomi.
4647	fast (adv.)	1. rianrang tein; e.g. His car will not go fast = A mawttawka khulrang in a kal kho lo; 2. fek tein; e.g. Hold fast to my hand = Ka kut fek tein i tlaih; 3. thinthi in; e.g. He is fast asleep = Thinthi in aa hngilh.

4649	fastidious (adj.)	miduhce.
4650	fasten (v.)	1. tom; e.g. He fastened the papers together = Caku kha hmun khat ah a tom hna; 2. hrenh; e.g. Fasten the doors before you go to bed = Na ih hlanah innka kha hrenh hna; 3. ttem
4651	fastener (n.)	ttemtu

4653	fastness (n.)	a himnak hmun, mi phak khawh lonak hmun; e.g. The bandits hid in their mountain fastness = Mifir pawl cu tlang i an i thuhnak hmun, an ca i hmun him a si i mi phak khawh set lonak a simi ah an i thup.

4656	fatal (adj.)	Thihnak tiang a phaktertu thil; e.g. He was knocked down by a car and received fatal injuries = Mawttawka nih a paw i thihnak tiang a simi hliamnak kha a hmuh.

4658	fatality (n.)	thihnak

4681	favor (n.) 5051	for (prep.)	1. can ah; e.g. He gave me a new book for the old one = Cauk hlun can ah khan a thar pakhat a ka pek; 2. dirpi; e.g. He stands for good government = Cozah ttha a dirpi; 3. hmaizahnak tuahpiak; e.g. A party was given for him = Rawl danghnak an tuahpiak; 4. lehnak; e.g. We thank him for his kindness = A zaangfahnak ruangah kan lawmh; 5. tinhmi ngeih; e.g. We go for a walk = Lam len ah kan kal; 6. aa tlak; e.g. A book for children = Ngakchia ca i a tlakmi cauk; 7. duhnak lungthin he; e.g. He longs for home = Inn a ngai; 8. caah cun; e.g. The weather is warm for January = January caah cun khuati a lum ko; 9. ruangah; e.g. to shout for joy = lawmhnak ruang i au; e.g.to punish for stealing = fir ruang i dantat; 10. tiang; e.g. We walk for a mile = Khan khat tiang kan kal; 11. chung; e.g. We work for an hour = Suimilam pakhat chung kan ttuan; 12. a si taktak kha; e.g. They know it for a fact = A si taktak kha an hngalh; 13. lei ah; e.g. He is leaving for his village = A khua lei ah a kal. for all intents and purposes = a zeiti lei paoh in, dengmang, tuah ding lei ti paohpaoh ahcun; for as much as = caah; for good = zungza; good for = Nguh; e.g. The food supply is good for one week = Rawl ca zarh khat caah a za lai; for instance = tahchunhnak ah.

5115	form (n.)	1. phun; e.g. Ice and snow are forms of water = Tikhal le hawhra cu ti phun an si; 2. mui, pungsam; e.g. the form of a man = mipa pungsan; 3. catlap, a chung i a herhmi ttialnak ca i lawnnak a ngeimi; 4. cafang ttialning; e.g. Broke is the past tense form of break = Broke cu break past tense ttialning a si.
5116	form (v.)	1. ser , i can; e.g. Ice formed in the pail = Baltin chungah ti kha tikhal ah a cang; 2. i can; e.g. Form a circle and join hands = A kulh pakhat ah i cang u law nan kut i sih u; 3. sersiam; e.g. Teachers help form the minds of children = Sayate nih ngakchia lungthin sersiam kha an bawmh hna.

5461	gesture (n.)	1. ruahnak le lungthin pum cawlcangh ningin langter, tahchunhnak ah kut zao, mit ttheh, cabuai, cumh; 2. zoh rem ding ca men i thau; e.g. His offer of help was only a gesture = Kan bawmh lai a timi cu zoh rem ca men i tuahmi a si.
5462	gesture (v.)	keimah lei zoh hna seh ti i cawlcangh; e.g. She gestured to attract our attention = Ka zoh hna seh ti duh ah a cawlcang len.
5463	get (v.)	1. hmuh; e.g. I expect to get some money = Tangka tlawmpal ka hmuh lai tiah ka ruah; 2. va la, va caw; e.g. Get some bread at the store = Chawdawr ah changreu va caw tuah; 3. thawn, tthial; e.g. We cannot get the tree out of the way = Thingkung kha lam in kan tthial kho lo; 4. timh, chumh; e.g. I have to get the dinner now = Atu cu zanriah ka timh (chumh) a hau; 5. lim, duh; e.g. When can you get your work done = Zeitik ah dah na rian cu na lim khawh lai?; 6. nawl khawh, tuahter khawh; e.g. I cannot get him to do this work = Hi rian hi ka tuanter kho lo; 7. sican; e.g. He can get sick easily = Fawi tein a zaw kho; 8. phak, phanh; e.g. When will you get to town = Zeitik ah dah khua na phak lai? get along = hawi he i rem; e.g. He gets along with his friends = A hawile he an i rem. get by = tuah khawh fangfang; e.g. I'll get by with your help = Na ka bawmhnak thawngin ka tuah khawh fangfang a si lai. get down to = i biatak, thawk; e.g. After lunch he gets down to work = Chuncaw ei dih in rian cu aa biatak (tawk). get even with = ti cu teirul cham tinak a si. get in = a chung i luh; e.g. He gets into the room = Khan chungah a lut. get off = kal tak, chuah, ttum; e.g. He gets off the plane = Vanlawng in a ttum. get out = chuah, chuak. get over = dam; e.g. He gets over his illness = A zawtnak in a dam. get through = lim; e.g. Hurry and get through with your work = I khulranh law na rian kha lim. get together = hmunkhat ah i pumh. get up = thawh, ihnak in thawh, tthutnak in thawh i dir.

5944	hamstring (n.)	thaphet thapi
5945	hand (n.)	1. kut; 2. minung kut bantuk; e.g. The hands of the clock = Suimilam kut; 3. zohkhenhnak, uknak; e.g. The child is in the hands of the parents = Ngakchia cu a nu le a pa zohkhenhnak tangah a um. at hand = pawngte i um peng; by hand = kut in ser, put, tuah; change hands = ngeitu i thlen; fight hand to hand = kut le kut i tawng in i tuk; from hand to mouth = i pek chin, i chanh chin vima; hand in hand = i naih tein, kut i tlai in; hands off = tawng hlah. hand's up = na kut hler hna, tei na si cnag ti langhternak. on hand = naite ah, vun lak zau awk i um; upper hand = tei deuh; e.g. They have the upper hand in the fight = An i paihnak ah khan anmah nih an tei deuh hna. wash one's hands = kei kai tel lo tiin kul i ttawl.

5968	hang (v.)	1. thlai, bat; e.g. Hang your coat on that hook = Na angkileng cu khi bahnak ah khin hei bat; 2. thah; e.g. The criminal was hanged (zong hung) = Misualpa cu an thah. hang back = hnu ah i thlai. hang on = i tlaihpeng; e.g. Hang on to this rope = Hi hri hi i tlaihpeng. hang out = fon; e.g. The boy is hanging out of the window = Ngakchiapa cu thlalangawng in a fong. hang together = hmunkhatte i um tti, i but. hang up = telefon in i chawnh i i chawnhnak chiahkanh khi; e.g. They hang up before I finished talking = Bia ka chim dih manh hlanah an ka ngol kanh.

6187	herself, himself (pron.)	1. amah le amah; e.g. She hurts herself = Amah le amah aa tu; 2. amahte nih; e.g. Mary did it by herself = Mary nih amahte in a tuah; 3. amah hrimhrim nih; e.g. Mary herself brought the book = Mary hrimhrim nih cauk kha a rak put; 4. amah kel a si; e.g. She is behaving strangely, she is not herself = A umtuning aa dang, amah kel a si lo.

6696	impeccable (adj.)	palhnak zeihmanh a ngei lomi , thil sual a tuah kho lomi
6697	impede (v.)	dawn
6698	impedement (n.)	dawnnak
6699	impel (v.)	hnek
6700	impend (v.)	a phan dengmangmi, a tla dengmangmi
6701	impenetrability (n.)	pemh khawh lonak
6702	impenetrable (adj.)	pemh khawh lomi
6703	impenitent (adj.)	i ngaihchih lo , aa ngaichih lomi
6704	imperative (adj.)	a herh hrimhrimmi , a si lo kho lomi
6705	imperative (n.)	nawlbia; e.g. The great imperative is 'Love your neighbor' (neighbour) = Nawlbia ngan cu "Na innpa kha va daw" ti a si.
6706	imperceptible (adj.)	hmuh khawh lomi , hngalh khawn lomi
6707	imperfect (adj.)	a tthatnak a tling lomi
6708	imperfection (n.)	tlin lonak
6709	imperial (adj.)	ram ukmi maw asiloah ram uktu he maw aa pehtlaimi thil
6710	imperialism (n.)	ramdang va uknak
6711	imperialist (n.)	ramdang a va uktu
6712	imperialistic (adj.)	ramdang va uk a duhmi
6713	imperil (v.)	harnak tlunter, phakter, ttihnunnak phakter
6714	imperious (adj.)	aa porhlawmi , a ruam a kaimi
6715	imperishable (adj.)	a rawk kho lomi , a hmun khomi thil
6716	impersonal (adj.)	pumpak a si lomi thil; e.g. "First come, first serve" is an impersonal remark = A ra hmasa paoh ei hmasa, ti hi pumpak a sawh lomi bia a si.
6717	impersonally (adv.)	pumpak i tinak zeihmanh um loin
6718	impersonate (v.)	mi nawl cawn , si lomi ka si i ti; e.g. Maung Maung impersonated Maung Khin = Maung Maung nih Maung Khin a si lo nain Maung Khin ka si, a ti.
6719	impersonation (n.)	si lomi ka si tiah i tinnak
6720	impertinence (n.)	mi hmaizah lonak , ninghngalnak
6721	impertinent (adj.)	ningzah hngal lo in a ummi , mi a hmaizah lomi , a ning a hngalmi
6722	imperturbable (adj.)	fawite i thin cawlcanghter khawh lomi , dai tein a ummi
6723	impetuosity (n.)	lungrannak
6724	impetuous (adj.)	milungtho kho ngaimi , thinhun zong a fawimi , lunglawmh zong a fawimi , tla cutmat i khua a sami , lungthin zong vut ti i aa letmi
6725	impetus (n.)	lungthin thawhtertu thil
6726	impiety (adj.)	Pathian zeirel lonak
6727	impinge (v.)	1. khen, tuk; e.g. Rays of light impinge on the eye = Ni ceu nih mit kha a khen; 2. ri en; e.g. Do not impinge on my boundary = Ka ramri ka eng hlah; * 'impinge' cu 'on' asiloah 'upon' he hman kemh a si.
6728	impious (adj.)	Pathian a hmaizah lomi, a upat lomi
6729	implacability (n.)	rem khawh lomi sinak
6730	implacable (adj.)	thin damter khawh lomi , rem khawh lomi
6731	implacably (adv.)	rem khawh loin
6732	implant (v.)	tuh
6733	implement (v.)	tuah , tlinter
6734	implement (n.)	thilri, hriamnam
6735	implicate (v.)	telh chih , i tel ve
6736	implication (n.)	telhchihnak, i telvenak
6737	implicit (adj.)	fiangte chim ttung lo i a sullam hngal hna seh tiin tuahmi , bia am in chimmi; e.g. He gave us implicit consent to take the apples, for he smiled when he saw us take them = Epal kha i lak hna seh ti a bia am in a kan duh ko, zeicahtiah kan lakah khan a merh.
6738	implicitly (adv.)	lung um lo tein; e.g. I trust him implicitly = Lung um lo tein ka zuhm.
6739	implore (v.)	fak piin nawl
6740	imploring (adj.)	fak piin a nawlmi
6741	imply (v.)	ding tein si lo in a vel in hngalhter; e.g. Your manner implies that you are not pleased with me = Na umtuning nih ka cungah naa lawm lo ti kha a vel in a ka hngalhter.
6742	impolite (adj.)	mi hmai a zah lomi
6743	impoliteness (n.)	mi hmaizah lonak
6744	import (v.)	ramdang in phiar
6745	import (n.)	1. ramdang in phiarmi thilri; 2. chim hnawhchan duhmi sullam
6746	importance (n.)	biapi sinak
6747	important (adj.)	biapi a simi
6748	importation (n.)	ramdang in thil phiarnak
6749	importer (n.)	ramdang in thil a cawtu
6750	impose (v.)	1. khinh, chonh; 2. rak duh set na lo i va helhhum peng
6751	imposing (adj.)	a lang bik, a ngan bik a simi
6752	imposition (n.)	mi dang cung i thilrit bantuk i vaa khinh pengnak.
6753	impossibility (n.)	si khawh lonak
6754	impossible (adj.)	a si kho lomi
6755	impossibly (adv.)	a si kho hrimhrim
6756	impost (n.)	ramdang in a lutmi thil cung i ngunkhuai lakmi
6757	impostor (n.)	mihlennak ding ca i mi min i lak, anih kha ka si i ti.
6758	imposture (n.)	mihlennak ca i si lomi anih kha ka si i tinak
6759	impotence (n.)	thil ti khawhnak ngeih lonak , nutnak
6760	impotent (adj.)	thil ti khawhnak a ngei lomi , pa a numi
6761	impotently (adv.)	zeihmanh tuah kho loin
6762	impoverish (v.)	ngeih loter , sifahter
6763	impoverishment (n.)	ngeih loternak , sifahternak
6764	impracticable (adj.)	tuah taktak tikah a si kho lomi
6765	impractical (adj.)	tuah knawh a si lo , san a tlai lomi
6766	imprecate (v.)	chiatserh
6767	imprecation (n.)	chiatserhnak
6768	impregnable (adj.)	pemh khawh lo , tei khawh lomi
6769	impregnate (v.)	fa pawiter
6770	impregnation (n.)	fa pawi ternak
6771	impress (v.)	1. nam, cakhenh; e.g. We can impress wax with a seal = Khuaiseng cu tazeih in kan nam khawh; 2. lungchung ah fek tein tuh, lunghmuih; e.g. I was impressed with what he preached = A phungchimmi kha kaa lunghmuih.
6772	impression (n.)	1. lunghmuihnak; 2. a tlangpi in ruahnak , fiang setsai loin zumh; e.g. It is my impression that they met before = Hlan ah an rak i tong cang lai tiah ka zumh ko; 3. cakhenhnak in nam i tazeih mui ca cung i a cuangmi khi; e.g. The impression of the seal on the wax was very clear = Khuaiseng cung i tazeih mui a cuangmi cu a fiang ngai.
6773	impressionable (adj.)	lungthin fawi tein lak khawhmi
6774	impressive (adj.)	lunghmui ngai a simi
6775	imprint (v.)	tazeih khenh
6776	imprint (n.)	neh; e.g. I saw an imprint of a bear's foot in the mud = Nawncek ah vom keneh ka hmuh.
6777	imprison (v.)	thong i thlak
6778	imprisonment (n.)	thong thlaknak
6779	improbability (n.)	si dawh si lonak
6780	improbable (adj.)	si dawh a si lomi

6782	improper (adj.)	aa tlak lomi
6783	impropriety (n.)	i tlak lonak
6784	improve (v.)	1. a ttha deuh; 2. tthatter deuh
6785	improvement (n.)	tthatter deuhnak
6786	improvise (v.)	i timhechungnak um lo i bia vun chim , hla vun phuah chom i vun sak.
6787	imprudence (n.)	ruat hmasa ciammam lo i thil tuahnak
6788	imprudent (adj.)	fim lo ruang i tlabulbal i um , ttha tein ruat hmasa lo i tuah
6789	impudence (n.)	zah hngal lomi raltthatnak
6790	impudent (adj.)	zah hngal lomi , zah hngalh loin ral a tthami
6791	impugn (v.)	bia in heh ti i al, bia in tuk
6792	impulse (n.)	1. duak tiah lungthin chung i a hung chuakmi duhnak; 2. tuahnak a umtertu tthawnnak
6793	impulsion (n.)	i forh i thazang thawhnak
6794	impulsive (adj.)	ruat suksak loin thil ti a hmangmi
6795	impunity (n.)	hremnak in luatnak , nganfah innak le sunghnak in luatnak

6797	impurity (n.)	thian lonak
6798	imputation (n.)	puhnak
6799	impute (v.)	puh , sual puh
6800	in (prep.)	1. chungah; e.g. We live in a house = Inn chungah kan um; 2. in; e.g. She is dressed in white = Thilthuam rang in aa thuam; 3. caah; e.g. The dinner was in honor of Mary's birthday = Zanriah cu Mary chuah lawmhnak caah a si; 4. ah; e.g. The board broke in two = Thingphel kha tan hnih ah aa tan; 5. lakah; e.g. They walked home in the rain = Ruahpi lakah inn ah an tin; 6. rian a ttuan; e.g. He is in government service = Amah cu cozah rian a ttuan. in any case = A zeiti lei hmanh in; e.g. In any case, you will have to go = A zeiti lei hmanh in na kal a herh ko lai. in any event = zei thil hmanh chuak ai kun; in case, in case of = A si sual ahcun; e.g. Bring your umbrella in case it rains = Ruah a sur sual lai, na nithawng i put; in custody = thong chung um. in earnest = i biatak tein; in favor (favour) of = amah ca i a ttha dingmi; in focus = a lai khen; in full = a dihlak in; in good faith = lihchim lo tein; in his favor (favour) = amah ca i a ttha dingmi; in order that = nakhnga; e.g. I must earn money in order that I may go to college = Khawleih i ka kai khawh nakhnga, tanka ka hmun a herh. in part = sawk; e.g. Na hmaan sawk. in passing = ruat setsai lem loin biatlang chuak i vun chim; e.g. He said it only in passing = Biatlanga a vung chuah i a vun chim pah menmi a si. in place of = amah can ah, amah hmun ah; in reality = a ngaingai ti ahcun; in short = a tawinak in; in spite of = nain; e.g. The children went to school in spite of the rain = Ruah a sur nain ngakchia cu sianginn an kai ko. in the event of = thil pakhatkhat a chuah sual ahcun; in the first instance = hmasa bik ah; in the long run = a donghnak ahcunn; in the presence of = hmaika ah; e.g. He signed his name in the presence of two witnesses = Tette pahnih hna hmaika ah min a thut. in time = tlawmpal hnu deuh ah; e.g. I shall be in time for dinner = Zanriah ei ah cun ka ra manh ko lai.
6801	in (pref.)	biafang thawknak i a um tikah lo tinak a si, 'correct / incorrect.'
6802	in (adv.)	chunglei ah; e.g. Bring your friend in = Na hawipa cu a chunglei ah run luhpi.
6803	in-law (n.)	rualchan, nupi pa, nupi nu, vale pa, vale nu, farle u farle nau, tale nau tlae u
6804	inability (n.)	tuah khawh lonak
6805	inaccessible (adj.)	phak khawh lomi
6806	inaccuracy (n.)	hmaan lonak
6807	inaccurate (adj.)	a hmaan lomi , palhnak a ummi
6808	inaction (n.)	tuah lonak , um sawsawhnak
6809	inactive (adj.)	a cawlcang huam lomi , a tthawng lomi

6816	inadvisable (adj.)	ruahnak cheuh awk ttha a si lomi
6817	inalienable (adj.)	chuh khawh a si lomi. zong unalienable.
6818	inanimate (adj.)	nunnak ngei lo , hlawptlo lo
6819	inapplicable (adj.)	aa rem lomi , aa tlak lomi , hman khawh a si lomi

6821	inappropriate (adj.)	aa tlak lo

6823	inarticulate (adj.)	bia fiang tein a chim lomi , a holh kho lomi
6824	inartistic (adj.)	aa dawh lomi, dawhnak a hngal kho lomi inasmuch
6825	as (conj.)	1. tiangah cun; 2. caah
6826	inattention (n.)	chimmi bia rak ngaih lonak , zei i rel lonak
6827	inattentive (adj.)	chimmi bia a rak ngai lomi
6828	inaudible (adj.)	hna in theih khawh lomi
6829	inaugural (adj.)	rian thawknak he aa pehtlaimi
6830	inaugurate (v.)	1. thawk; e.g. Several new courses were inaugurated in the school this year = Tukum cu siangin ah cawn awk thar tam nawn an thawk; 2. rian nganpi ttuan ding i fehter, rian thawk; e.g. The President of the United States of America is usually inaugurated in January = America ram President cu January thla ah rian thawk dingin an fehter tawn.
6831	inauguration (n.)	sunglawi ngaiin rianttuan thawknak tuah

6847	incentive (n.)	lungthawhnak

6852	inch (n.)	lehhmah; e.g. An inch of rainfall is the amount of water that would cover a surface to the depth of one inch = Ruahpi lehhmah pakhat a sur ti cu ruah nih kha surnak hmun khat lehhmah pakhat in a khuh khawh tinak a si.

6923	incumbent (n.)	Rian a ttuan liomi; e.g. incumbent pastor = Rian a ttuan liomi pastor
6924	incumbent (adj.)	ka cungah aa khing ti in ruahmi; e.g. She felt it incumbent on her to answer the letter at once = Cakuat cu leh zau awk a si ti kha ka cungah aa khingmi a si tiin a ruah.
6925	incur (v.)	1. hman, tangka hman; 2. mah cung i tlunter
6926	incurable (adj.)	damter khawh lomi

6931	indeclinable (adj.)	a cafang ttialning thlen khawh a si lomi bia
6932	indeed (adv.)	ngaingai , taktak
6933	indefatigable (adj.)	a tha a ba kho lomi
6934	indefensible (adj.)	khamh khawh a si lomi , chanh khawh a si lomi
6935	indefinable (adj.)	a sullam fianter khawh a si lomi
6936	indefinite (adj.)	1. a fiang set lo, sawhmi theng a ngei lo; e.g. He gave me an indefinite answer = A ka lehnak a fiang set lo; 2. caan tuk, caan khiah a um lomi; e.g. We have an indefinite time to finish the work = Hi rian limnak dingah caan tukmi kan ngei lo; 3. sawhmi set a ngei lomi; e.g. The indefinite articles are 'a' and 'an' = 'a' le 'an' cu pakhat tinak an si i sawhmi theng an ngei lo.
6937	indelible (adj.)	hloh khawh lomi , hnawh khawh lomi
6938	indemnify (v.)	cham , tthat lonak le sunghnak tuahpiakmi cham
6939	indemnity (n.)	chamnak
6940	indent (v.)	1. khuar, rek; e.g. The boys indent the stick = Ngakchia nih tthiangtthunh kha an khuar, an rek; 2. chunglei i pilter; e.g. When you type, indent five spaces to begin a paragraph = seh in ca na ttial tikah, paragraph thawknak ah deh nga a chunglei ah na pilter lai; 3. thil cah, thil ca in cah
6941	indentation (n.)	thilcahnak, khuarnak, reknak, pilternak
6942	independence (n.)	mahte in i uknak
6943	independent (adj.)	1. mahte in aa ukmi ram; 2. mahte in a um i hawi a bochan lomi

6948	finger (n.)	laibawi (kutdong).

6953	indices (n.)	index i a plural; 'index' a zoh.
6954	indict (v.)	taza cuai awkah aa tlak ti in a sualnak hmuh

7509	-ism - (suff.) cafang donghnak ah chap tawnmi; tahchunhnak ah; e.g. 'baptize' cu 'baptism', 'criticize' cu 'criticism.'

7514	issue (v.)	1. chuah; e.g. The magazine is issued once a month = Mekkazin cu thla khat ah voi khat an chuah; 2. pek; e.g. Food and clothing are issued to the soldiers = Ralkap cu rawl le hnipuan an chuah hna.
7515	issue (n.)	1. ca chuahmi; e.g. The last issue of the newspaper contains the story of his accident = Tadinca an chuahmi a hmanung bik ah eksident a tonnak kong kha a um; 2. zapi nih an ceih lulhmi; e.g. Football is a current issue = Atu lio i zapi nih an ceih lulhmi cu pumpululh a si, i ceih lengmangmi.
7516	-ist - (suff.) biafang donghnak lei i chapmi; e.g. 'tour' cu 'tourist', 'piano' cu 'pianist.'
7517	isthmus (n.)	vawlei nganpipi pahnih a pehtu vawlei rawrek; Panama Isthmus = Panama vawlei rawrek.
7518	it (pron.)	thil, hmun, thil ummi, ruahnak, a um ciami chim tthan tik i hmanmi bia; a tawinak bik cu 'a', ti a si ko; e.g. He saw a house and bought it = Inn pakhat a hmuh i a cawk; e.g. It is rainy = Ruah a sur; e.g. This book is good. It is worth reading = Hi cauk hi a ttha, rel tlak a si.
7519	italic (n.)	cafang ngawi

7521	italicize (v.)	cafang ngawi in ttial
7522	itch (n.)	thakpherh zawtnak , a thakmi
7523	item (n.)	1. a bu chung i thil pakhatkhat , cazin chung i ttialmi thil pakhatkhat; e.g. The first item on the programme (U.S. program) is reading names of the members of the committee = Prokarem chung i thil hmasa bik cu komiti member hna min rel kha a si; 2. thawngpang pelpawi tadinca i chuahmi.
7524	itemize (v.)	pakhat hnu pakhat in ttial

7528	it's (v., contraction)	'it is' ; vanlawng na tahn lo cu a poi ngangai ko; e.g. It's a pity = Ngaihchiat awk a simi.
7529	its (adj., pron.)	a ta, a ngeihmi; e.g. The cat plays with its kittens = Chizawh cu a fale he lente an i celh.
7530	itself (pron.)	1. fek deuh in chim duh tik i hmanmi a si; e.g. The land itself is worth the money, without the house = A vawlei lawng-lawng hmanh kha tangka pekmi cu a man ko, a inn chim loin; 2. amah can ah khan hman a si; e.g. The baby hurt itself =Ngakchia cu amah le amah aa tu; 3. mah le mah; e.g. The dog saw itself in the glass = Uico nih thlalang chungah amah le amah aa hmu.
7531	-ity - (suff.) holh fang donghnak ah chapmi; e.g. 'active' cu 'activity' ah a cang, 'sincere' cu 'sincerity' ah a cang
7532	I've (contraction)	I have.
7533	ivory (n.)	vui hao

8066	light (n.)	ceunak; in light of = hngalh ningin, chimmi nih ceunak a pek ningin; e.g. In the light of weather report, it will be rainy today = Khuati kong an chim ningin, nihin cu ruahpi a sur lai.

8076	like (adj.)	1. an i lo; 2. bantuk; e.g. She can sing like a bird = Vate bantuk in a sak khawh; 3. hrawng; e.g. Something like one hundred kyats = Tangka za khat hrawng; 4. a si hrimhrim lai ti khawh dengmang a si; e.g. It looks like rain today = Nihin cu ruah sur nih a dawh ko; 5. duh; e.g. I feel like going to the movies = Baisikup zoh ka duh bang a ti.

8595	matted (adj.)	aa sengh dihmi
8596	matter (n.)	1. thil 2. thil pakhatkhat a hung ummi; e.g. An important matter kept him from going to his village = Thilbiapi pakhat nih an khua kal kha a thlauh 3. cauk chung i ummi thil/ruahnak; e.g. The matter in your book is good but the style is bad = Na cauk chung i ruahnak a ummi cu a ttha, sihmanhselaw na ttialning cu a ttha lo 4. harnak; e.g. What is the matter with the sick child? - A zawmi ngakchia kha zeidah a harnak a si? 5. What is the matter with you? = Na zeidah a ti? 6. tongh khawh hmuh khawhmi thil; e.g. Wood and stone are matters = Thing le lung cu tongh khawhmi thil an si matter of = e.g. The distance between Mangnu and Hakha is a matter of six miles = Mangnu le Hakha kar cu khan ruk hrawng a si ko; as a matter of fact = a ngaingai ti ahcun; for that matter
8597	matter (v.)	biapi a si; e.g. What people say matters to him = Mi nih a chimmi kha biapi ngaiin a ruah.

8602	mature (adj.)	1. patling/nutling a simi; e.g. He is a mature man = Patling a si; 2. ttha tein, tleng lakin ruahmi; e.g. He gives a mature opinion = Ruahnak tleng a chuahpi.
8603	mature (v.)	1. hmin; e.g. Pears mature quickly = Piar cu khulrangin an hmin. 2. nutling/patling si; e.g. He matures faster than his brother = A unau nakin khulrang deuh in a patling.
8604	maturely (adj.)	nutling/patling ngaiin
8605	maturity (n.)	nutling/patling sinak
8606	maul (v.)	tthalo in, cei cikcek in tthuat (seh); e.g. He was mauled by the bear = Vom nih a seh.
8607	maul (n.)	tanbo
8608	mausoleum (n.)	thlan nganpi
8609	maxim (n.)	phungthlukbia
8610	maximum (adj.)	a tam bik , a sang bik
8611	may (v.)	1. i chawnh tik i holh ttha i hmanmi, mah lei a si ahcun 'ning' tinak, mi lei a si ahcun, nem tein tuah fial. e.g. May I come in = Rung lut ning? e.g. May you be happy = Lunglawm tein na um nakhnga. 2. a si kho; e.g. It may rain today = Nihin ruah a sur kho men. 3.. tuah ahcun a ttha ko lai, a ttha lo ko lai; e.g. You may as well stay where you are = Na umnak ah khan um law i ttha ko lai. 4. ko seh; e.g. May they live long = Saupi nung ko hna seh. 5.. nakhnga; e.g. I will write to him so that he may know when we will arrive = Zeitik ah dah kan phak lai kha a hngalh nakhnga ca ka kuat lai. 6.. sual ko hnga; e.g. I'm afraid the news may be true = Tadin cu a hmaan sual ko hnga ti ka phang. 7. lai, ko hnga; e.g. He may arrive today = Nihin a phan ko hnga.
8612	May (n., prop.)	Mei thla
8613	May apple (n., prop.)	bawnbawk.
8614	maybe (adv.)	a si kho ko, a si men lai; e.g. Maybe we will go tomorrow = Thaizing cu kan kal men lai, kan kal kho men.
8615	mayor (n.)	khuapi uktu bawi
8616	maze (n.)	1. lam i kalh nuk i a umnak hmun khi, cucaah tlau a fawi i lam zulh awk hngalh a harnak hmun. 2. lungchung i tuai ngai i um i zeidah ka tuah lai ti i hngal kho set lo i um khi.
8617	me (pron.)	keimah, biatlang a donghnak lei ah hmanmi; e.g. He helps me = A ka bawmh. Biatlang a thawknak ah cun 'I' hman a si; e.g. I help him = Ka bawmh.
8618	meadow (n.)	ramhring khawhnak hmun
8619	meager (adj.)	U.S. tlawmte.
8620	meagre (adj.)	British. tlawmte.
8621	meal (n.)	1. rawl; e.g. Breakfast is the first meal of the day = Thaithawh hi ni khat chung rawl hmasa bik a si. 2. dip lakin phomhmi rawl;; e.g. Corn is ground into meal = Fangvoi cu dip lakin an phomh.
8622	mealtime (n.)	rawl ei can.
8623	mean (v.)	1. sullam; e.g. What does this word mean = Hi biafang hi a sullam zeidah a si? 2. sawh, langhter, hngalhter; e.g. The dark clouds mean it will rain = Khua-dawm nak nih ruah a sur lai ti kha an langhter. 3. timh, tinh; e.g. He did not mean to hurt her feelings = A lun fahter kha aa tim/tinh lo.
8624	mean (adj.)	1. zaangfahnak ngei lo, ziaza ttha lomi 2. khiar, hnem; e.g. He is too mean to pay his workers well = A khiar tuk i a rianttuantu pawl kha ttha tein an hlawh a pe duh hna lo.
8625	mean (n.)	a laivuang; e.g. The mean salary of the workers is three hundred kyats per month = Rianttuantu cu thla khat i za thum hi a si.
8626	meander (v.)	tiva i ngerh len in a luan khi
8627	meaning (n.)	sullam
8628	means (n.)	1. thil hmuh khawhnak/tuah khawhnak ca i hmanmi thil; e.g. He will use any means to win = Teinak a si paoh ahcun zei thil paoh a hman ko lai. 2. rumnak, chawva tangka; e.g. He has means to buy a house = Inn cawknak tangka a ngei ko. by all means = zeitilei paoh hmanh in tuah ko by no means = zeitilei paoh hmanh in tuah hlah
8629	meant (v.)	past tense & participle of mean, a sullam a si ti; e.g. He meant what he said = A chimmi kha a sullam a chim duhmi a si ko.
8630	meantime (n.)	a karlak caan; e.g. He left at four and returned at seven, and she wrote two letters in the meantime = Pali ah a kal i pasarih ah a ra kir tthan, a karlakah cakuat pahnih a ttial.
8631	meantime (adv.)	1. cu caan chungah; e.g. Her husband was away six months, meantime she looked after the cows = A va cu thla ruk khual a tlawng, cu chung cu amah nih caw kha a zoh hna. 2. a caan aa khat in, pah in; e.g. She set the table, meantime she cooked lunch = Cabuai ah khan rawl a ser pah, cu pah cun/cu lioah cun, chuncaw a chuanpah.
8632	meanwhile (n., adv.)	meantime he aa khat.
8633	measles (n.)	hmaihu zawtnak
8634	measure (n.)	1. tahnak, tlangrel 2. timhmi tlinnak ca i tuahmi rian; e.g. The city has taken measures to improve the roads = Lam kha ttha deuh in tuah awkah khuapi nih rian an ttuan cang.
8635	measure (v.)	1. tah; e.g. She measured the length of the house = Inn a saulei kha a tah; 2. a sau / a tawi a si; e.g. The table measured 9 feet by 3 feet = Cabuai cu pe 9 a sau i pe 3 a kau.
8636	measurement (n.)	tahnak, a sau, a kauh, a san; e.g. The measurement of the table is 3 feet long, 2 feet wide and 3 feet high = Cabuai cu pe 3 a sau, pe 2 a kau i pe 3 a sang.

8719	merit (n.)	1. tthatnak; e.g. His work has some merit = A rian cu tthatnak a ngei ve; 2. a sining taktak in; e.g. The court will judge the case on its own merits = Biaceihtu nih bia cu a si ningte khan an ceih ko lai.

8810	mind (n.)	1. lungthin, ruahnak; 2. ruahmi; e.g. He speaks his mind = A ruahmi a chim; 3. khuaruah khawhnak; e.g. He has lost his mind = A lungthin a tlau cang; 4. mifim ngaingai; e.g. He is one of our great minds = Amah cu kan mifim hna lak i pakhat a si. presence of mind = thil har pakhatkhat a chuah tik i khulrangte i ruahnak ngeih khawhnak; absence of mind = mah tuahmi kha zei a si ti hngalh khawh lo; bear in mind = pilh hlah; have a mind to = cuhnak ngeih; keep your mind on what you are doing = Na tuahmi kha ruat peng ko. have in mind = lungchung in i timh; make up one's mind = lung i tlek; of one mind = lungthin khat; out of one's mind = Hruh, molh; e.g. He acts as if he is out of his mind = A hrut bantukin a tuah.
8811	mind (v.)	1. duh lo , al , poi; e.g. Do you mind if I smoke = Kuak zu ning law, ha al hnga maw, a poi na ti hnga maw? 2. i ralring; e.g. Mind what you are doing = Na tuahmi kha i ralring; 3. nawlngaih; e.g. The child will not mind his mother = Ngakchia nih a nu nawlngaih a duh lo. never mind = a poi lo, na lungrethei hlah.
8812	mine (pron.)	keimah ta; e.g. This house is mine =  Hi inn cu keimah ta a si.
8813	mine (n.)	1. vawlei chung i cawhmi khor; e.g. Coal mine = Lung meihol khor 2. vawlei tang i phummi bom
8814	mine (v.)	1. vawlei cawh; e.g. They were mining for gold = Sui an co; 2. bom phum; e.g. The place was mined during the war = Ral lioah kha hmun ah khan bom an phum.
8815	miner (n.)	vawlei chung thil kawl i a khor cotu
8816	mineral (n.)	vawlei chung thilri ; thir, dar, sur, ngun, etc.; e.g. Iron is a mineral = Thir hi mineral a si.
8817	mineral (adj.)	mineral a ummi; e.g. Mineral water = Mineral a ummi ti
8818	mineralogy (n.)	vawlei chung thilri kong cawnnak
8819	mingle (v.)	i cawh, hmunkhat i umti; e.g. He is very shy and does not mingle with others = Mi ningzah thiam ngai a si i mi dang he an i cawh lo.

8824	minimum (adj.)	a tlawn bik, a niam bik a simi.
8825	mining (n.)	vawlei chung thil chuahnak rian
8826	minister (n.)	1. fehternak (ordination) a hmumi pastor. 2. vuanci.
8827	minister (v.)	rianttuan; e.g. The nurse ministered to the needs of the sick = Si sayama nih mizaw cu an herhnak kha a tuahpiak /tuanpiak hna.
8828	ministerial (adj.)	vuanci rian a simi, pastor rian a simi.
8829	ministry (n.)	1. Cozah rianttuannak bu; e.g. Ministry of Finance = Tangka lei rianttuannak bu; 2. Pathian lei rianttuannak; e.g. He entered the ministry = Pathian rian ah a lut.
8830	mink (n.)	saram phun khat , a phaw angki lum ca i a ttha ngaimi
8831	minor (adj.)	a hme deuhmi
8832	minor (n.)	kum tling lo
8833	minority (n.)	mi tlawm deuh pawl
8834	minster (n.)	Khrihfa phungki pawl umnak i an biakinn, biakinn nganpi.
8835	mint (n.)	1. tangka sernak hmun; 2. tampi; e.g. He has a mint of ideas = Ruahnak tampi a ngei.
8836	mint (v.)	tangka ser; e.g. They minted a new coin = Tangka thar an ser
8837	mint (adj.)	a thar tluk; e.g. The car is in mint condition = Mawttaka cu a thar tluk a si ko.
8838	minus (prep.)	zuh; e.g. Six minus two is four = Paruk ah pahnih zuh cu pali a si.
8839	minute (n.)	1. minit; e.g. There are sixty minutes in one hour =Suimilam pakhat ah minit sawm ruk a um; 2. caan tawite; 3. cangka in; e.g. Please give him the book, the minute you see him = Na hmuh cangka tein cauk hi pe te.
8840	minute (adj.)	mainiuh tiah a awchuah a si, a hmete; e.g. A minute particle of sand = Thetse fang hmete.
8841	minutely (adv.)	mainiuhly, hme tein
8842	minuteness (n.)	mainiuhness, hmetnak.
8843	minutes (n.)	minits ti in awchuah a si, biakhiahmi ttialmi.
8844	miracle (n.)	khuaruahhar thil
8845	miraculous (adj.)	khuaruahhar a simi
8846	mirage (n.)	a si taktak lomi a si bantukin a langmi, thetse ram i khualtlawngmi hna nih ti um lopi kha tilipi bantuk in an hmuh tawn i cucu 'mirage' cu a si.
8847	mire (n.)	nawncek
8848	mirror (n.)	bihnak thlalang
8849	mirror (v.)	mui langh; e.g. The stars are mirrored in the still water = Arfi cu a cawlcang lomi ti chungah an lang.

8851	mirthful (adj.)	lunglawm thanuammi

8861	miscarriage (n.)	1. tuahmi thluachuah lonak 2. nau rawknak
8862	miscarry (v.)	1. thlua a chuak lo; e.g. His plan miscarried = A khua khanmi thlua a chuak lo; 2. nau rawk; e.g. She miscarried because of her illness = A zawt ruangah a nau ai rawk.
8863	miscellaneous (adj.)	thil dangdang aa cawh dihmi
8864	miscellany (n.)	thil dangdang aa cawhmi

8907	misrepresent (v.)	a kong a hmaan loin chim; e.g. He misrepresented this car when he said that it was in good running order = Hi mawttaka hi a ttha ko tiah a ti tikah a hmaan loin a kong a chim a si.
8908	misrepresentation (n.)	a hmaan loin a kong chimnak
8909	misrule (v.)	ttha loin uk
8910	miss (v.)	1. nganh; e.g. He fired at a tiger, but missed it = Cakei cu a kah, asinain a nganh; 2. ngaih; e.g. The child misses her mother = Ngakchia cu a nu a ngai; 3. tanh lo; e.g. We missed the train = Tlanglawng kan tanhmanh lo.
8911	Miss (prop., abbrev.)	ngaknu; e.g. Miss Sara Martin; e.g. Miss Smith, may I present Mr. Brown = Miss Smith, hi pa hi Mr. Brown a si.

8960	model (adj.)	zohchun awk tlak a simi
8961	model (v.)	sining zulh; e.g. The boy modeled himself after his father = Ngakchiapa nih a pa sining zulh kha aa zuam; i zoh chun.

9026	monosyllable (n.)	biafang pakhat awfang pakhat a ngeimi biafang (holh), tahchunhnak ah E ti cu biafang pakhat awfang pakhat a ngeimi a si i sullam zong a ngei, A ti cu biafang pakhat awfang pakhat a ngeimi a si i sullam zong a ngei

9060	morbid (adj.)	a ngan a dam lomi thil , a ngan a dam lomi ruahnak lungthin
9061	more (adj.)	1. tam deuh, ngan deuh 2. a hlei; e.g. We need two more men = Minung pahnih a hlei kan herh; 3. a dang; e.g. You can get more information tomorrow = Thaizing ah tadin dang na hmuh khawh lai.
9062	more (n.)	tam deuh; e.g. Give him some more = Tam deuh in pe rih.
9063	more (adv.)	1. deuh in; e.g. A plane travels more rapidly than a train = Vanlawng cu tlanglawng nakin khulrang deuhin a kal. 2. tthan; e.g. Tell me the story once more = Tuanbia cu voi khat in ka chim tthan. more or less = an si dih ngawt ko; e.g. Most people are more or less selfish = Mi tam bik cu mah zawn ruat an si dih ngawt ko.
9064	moreover (adv.)	hlei ah; e.g. I didn't want to go fishing, moreover the weather was bad = Nga sio kal ka duh lo, cuhleiah nikhua a chia fawn.
9065	mores (n.)	phunglam , phungphai
9066	morning (n.)	zingka , zinglei morning

9071	morphia (n.)	bing
9072	morphine (n.)	mitkuh si

9074	morsel (adj.)	tlawmte, ka khat lawng
9075	mortal (adj.)	thihpi awk tlak ; a thi dingmi a thi khomi
9076	mortality (n.)	1. a thi khomi sinak; 2. thih zat; e.g. The mortality rate is high = A thimi zat an tam ko.
9077	mortally (adv.)	thi dingin.
9078	mortar (n.)	1. thung , thetse le ti cawh i senghnak ca i hmanmi 2. miakpi hmete 3. sum suknak sum
9079	mortgage (n.)	tangka cawimi aamahkhannak ca thil; e.g. Tim holds a one thousand kyat mortgage on Jim's house = Tim nih Jim cu tangka thong khat a cawih i cu tangka cun inn a sak i cu tangka a cawimi cu Jim nih khan a inn khan aamah a khan.
9080	mortification (n.)	takpum i hremnak
9081	mortify (v.)	takpum i hrem, biaknak ruang i takpum i hrem
9082	mortise, mortice (n.)	thing pehnak chung i thing pehmi a va luhnak awng khi mortise ti a si i a va lutmi bo khi tenon ti a si.
9083	mortuary (n.)	mithi chiahnak inn
9084	mosaic (n.)	thawi tehn bantukin lung in siseh thlalang in siseh tamh i tenh.
9085	Moslem (n., prop.)	Muslim biaknak a zulmi.
9086	mosque (n.)	Muslim biakinn
9087	mosquito (n.)	fikfa
9088	moss (n.)	lung bangbuar
9089	most (n., adj.)	1. bik; e.g. She is the most pretty girl = Amah cu aa dawh bikmi ngaknu a si. 2. tam bik, a dihlak nawn; e.g. Most schools open in June = Sianginn a tam bik cu June ah an hun. at most, at the most = a tam bik ah; e.g. At most five of us will go = A tam bik ah panga kan kal lai. make the most of = a tthatnak bik in hman; e.g. While we wait let us make the most of our time by reading = Kan hngan lioah, kan caan cu relnak ah kan hman ahcun a tthahnem bik lai.
9090	mostly (adv.)	a tam bik cu; e.g. The students are mostly bright = Siangngakchia a tam bik cu an lung a var.
9091	moth (n.)	pelep
9092	mother (n.)	hringtu nu
